means: 生存
居住
生活，过活
在生活中得到享受
经历
度过
活着的
生动的，有精神的
精力充沛的
现场直播的
在（表演）现场，实况地

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"活着的，活的"之意。
means: alive ：其反义词为dead，指生命从奄奄一息到精力旺盛的各种状态。
live ：通常作定语，指活生生的，生气勃勃的，还可表示现场直播的。
living ：其反义词为dead，指包括人和动植物的生命没有消失、仍然存在的状态。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"居住，定居"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: dwell, reside, live, lodge, inhabit, settle
means: dwell ： 文学上的用词，口语中通常用live代替。
reside ： 书面用词，指合法的永久性居住，也指在豪华的住宅里居住。
live ： 最普通用词，指固定的居住，可以是长期的，也可以是临时的。
lodge ： 指短时间或临时住宿。
inhabit ： 强调人或动物居住在某个地区并已适应某种特殊环境。
settle ： 侧重指某人定居于城市、国家或地区，而不指居住的住所。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"存在"之意。
means: exist ： 通常指可观察到的或众所周知的存在现象。
be ： 指某时某地确存在的事物或现象，多与there连用。
live ： 多指有生命的东西的存在。指无生命事物时，强调可联想起生命的那些特点。

sentence.Network_en: For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbours, and laugh at them in our turn?
sentence.Network_cn: 我们活着是为了什么？不就是给邻居当笑柄，再反过来笑他们。

sentence.Network_en: I will return, find you, love you, marry you and live without shame.
sentence.Network_cn: 我会回去，找到你，爱你，娶你，活的光明正大。《赎罪》

sentence.Network_en: I clearly empathize with the people who live in those neighborhoods.
sentence.Network_cn: 我非常同情生活在那些地方的人们。

jx.jx_en_mean: To overcome or reduce the shame of (a misdeed, for example) over a period of time.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 洗心革面：在一段时间后克服或减轻了（如罪行）带来的耻辱

jx.jx_en_mean: To reside in the place where one is employed
To live outside one's place of domestic employment

lj.lj_ls: 不住在主人家的仆人们

jx.jx_en_mean: To put up with; resign oneself to

lj.lj_ly: disliked the situation but had to live with it.
lj.lj_ls: 不喜欢这种状态但必须忍受它

jx.jx_en_mean: used, especially in spoken English, to express one's surprise at coming across someone or something
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［多用于英语口语中，表达见到某人某事的惊喜］真没想到

lj.lj_ly: good God, Jack Stone, as I live and breathe!.
lj.lj_ls: 老天，杰克•斯通，真没想到！。

jx.jx_en_mean: be extremely interested in or enthusiastic about a particular subject or activity and so devote a great deal of one's time to it

lj.lj_ly: they live and breathe Italy and all things Italian.
lj.lj_ls: 他们热衷于意大利和与意大利有关的所有东西。

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)you should tolerate the opinions and behaviour of others so that they will similarly tolerate your own
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)给别人留点儿面子（或： 自己活也让别人活；相互宽容）

jx.jx_en_mean: do something risky, especially on a habitual basis
be or remain optimistic about something
have old-fashioned or outdated ideas and attitudes
jx.jx_cn_mean: 活在过去里，思想守旧，老古董

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English libban, lifian, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch leven and German leben, also to life and leave

encyclopedia.content: LIVE 有生存居住等英文含义 ，多用于生活的解释，也有微软的LIVE 网络，LIVE乐队等等，电视台也用于实况转播的意思。另解是美国的一个乐队。

entry.def: If someone lives in a particular place or with a particular person, their home is in that place or with that person.

example.ex: She has lived here for 10 years...
example.tran: 她在这里住了10年了。

example.ex: She always said I ought to live alone...
example.tran: 她总说我应该一个人住。

entry.def: If you say that someone lives in particular circumstances or that they live a particular kind of life, you mean that they are in those circumstances or that they have that kind of life.

example.ex: We lived quite grandly...
example.tran: 我们生活得非常快乐。

example.ex: Compared to people living only a few generations ago, we have greater opportunities to have a good time...
example.tran: 比起上几辈人，我们有更多机会享受生活。

entry.def: If you say that someone lives for a particular thing, you mean that it is the most important thing in their life.

example.ex: He lived for his work.
example.tran: 他为工作而活。

entry.def: To live means to be alive. If someone lives to a particular age, they stay alive until they are that age.

example.ex: He's got a terrible disease and will not live long...
example.tran: 他已身患重疾，时日无多。

example.ex: A perennial is a plant that lives indefinitely...
example.tran: 多年生植物是指能存活很多年的植物。

entry.def: If people live by doing a particular activity, they get the money, food, or clothing they need by doing that activity.

example.ex: ...the last indigenous people to live by hunting...
example.tran: 最后一个狩猎为生的土著民族

example.ex: These crimes were committed largely by professional criminals who lived by crime.
example.tran: 这些罪案大都是由以犯罪为生的职业罪犯制造的。

entry.def: If you live by a particular rule, belief, or ideal, you behave in the way in which it says you should behave.

example.ex: They live by the principle that we are here to add what we can to life, not to get what we want from it.
example.tran: 他们恪守着这样的原则：我们来到世上是要为生活做贡献，而不是从中索取。

entry.def: If a person or occasion lives in someone's mind or in history, they are remembered for a long time.

example.ex: The memory of that will live with me for many years to come...
example.tran: 那个记忆将会伴随我多年。

example.ex: His name will live in history as one of the greatest bowlers of all time...
example.tran: 他将会作为史上最伟大的板球投手之一而留名青史。

entry.def: If you say that someone lives and breathes a particular subject or activity, you are emphasizing that they are extremely enthusiastic about it.

example.ex: He has lived and breathed polo since he was seven.
example.tran: 他从7岁开始就一直热衷于马球。

entry.def: If you tell someone that they haven't lived unless they experience a particular thing, you are telling them that thing is extremely good and should be experienced.

example.ex: If you have never been to an opera, you haven't  lived...
example.tran: 要是从来没看过歌剧，那就枉过此生了。

example.ex: You haven't lived until you've used their new micro system.
example.tran: 要是没用过他们新的微系统，这辈子就算白活了。

entry.def: You can use expressions such as to live in fear and to live in terror to indicate that someone is always thinking about an unpleasant or frightening event, because they think that it might happen.

example.ex: One in 10 Californians is unemployed and thousands more live in fear of losing their jobs.
example.tran: 十分之一的加利福尼亚人没有工作，还有数以千计的人成天提心吊胆地害怕失去工作。

entry.tran: 自己活也让别人活；互相宽容；互不干扰
entry.def: You say live and let live as a way of saying that you should let other people behave in the way that they want to and not criticize them for behaving differently from you.
If you live it up, you have a very enjoyable and exciting time, for example by going to lots of parties or going out drinking with friends.

example.ex: There is no reason why you couldn't live it up once in a while.
example.tran: 偶尔放纵一下也无妨。

entry.def: Live animals or plants are alive, rather than being dead or artificial.

example.ex: ...a protest against the company's tests on live animals.
example.tran: 反对该公司利用活体动物做试验的抗议

example.ex: ...baskets of live chickens.
example.tran: 一篮篮的活鸡

entry.tran: 现场直播的；实况转播的
entry.def: A live television or radio programme is one in which an event or performance is broadcast at exactly the same time as it happens, rather than being recorded first.

example.ex: Murray was a guest on a live radio show.
example.tran: 默里在一个直播的电台节目里当嘉宾。

example.ex: ...we were laughing and gossiping, oblivious to the fact that we were on live TV...
example.tran: 我们肆意大笑，闲聊八卦，忘记了自己是在做电视直播。

entry.def: A live performance is given in front of an audience, rather than being recorded and then broadcast or shown in a film.

example.ex: The Rainbow has not hosted live music since the end of 1981...
example.tran: 1981年末之后，彩虹剧院就再没主办过现场音乐会。

example.ex: A live audience will pose the questions...
example.tran: 问题将由现场的观众提出。

entry.def: A live recording is a recording of a band playing at a concert, rather than in a studio.

example.ex: This is my favourite live album of all time...
example.tran: 这是我最喜爱的现场专辑。

example.ex: The LP features live recordings from the 'Great Xpectations' all-day show.
example.tran: 这张大碟收录了“远大前程”全天秀的现场录音。

entry.def: A live wire or piece of electrical equipment is directly connected to a source of electricity.

example.ex: The plug broke, exposing live wires...
example.tran: 插头坏了，带电的电线露在外面。

example.ex: He warned others about the live electric cables as they climbed to safety.
example.tran: 他们爬向安全地带的过程中，他提醒其他人当心带电的电缆。

entry.def: Live bullets are made of metal, rather than rubber or plastic, and are intended to kill people rather than injure them.

example.ex: They trained in the jungle using live ammunition.
example.tran: 他们在丛林中接受真枪实弹的训练。

entry.def: A live bomb or missile is one which has not yet exploded.

example.ex: A live bomb had earlier been defused.
example.tran: 一枚未爆炸的炸弹稍早被拆除了雷管。

entry.def: If a system, campaign, or other course of action goes live, it starts to be used.

example.ex: The new system went live earlier this year...
example.tran: 新系统在今年早些时候开始了运行。

example.ex: The service should go live this summer.
example.tran: 这项服务将在今年夏天投入使用。

entry.def: You use real live to say that someone or something is present or exists, when you want to indicate that you think this is exciting and unusual or unexpected.

example.ex: He had never met a real live admiral...
example.tran: 他从来没遇到过一位真正的海军上将。

example.ex: She has the best pet of all — a real live tiger.
example.tran: 她有世上最佳的宠物——一只活生生的老虎。

means.word_mean: 1. make one's home or live in;

sentences.sentence: "These people inhabited all the islands that are now deserted"

means.word_mean: 2. lead a certain kind of life; live in a certain style;

sentences.sentence: "we had to live frugally after the war"

means.word_mean: 3. continue to live; endure or last;

sentences.sentence: "We went without water and food for 3 days"
"These superstitions survive in the backwaters of America"
"The racecar driver lived through several very serious accidents"
"he could barely exist on such a low wage"
"Can you live on $2000 a month in New York City?"
"Many people in the world have to subsist on $1 a day"
"My grandfather lived until the end of war"

means.word_mean: 6. have firsthand knowledge of states, situations, emotions, or sensations;

sentences.sentence: "I have lived a kind of hell when I was a drug addict"
"The holocaust survivors have lived a nightmare"

means.word_mean: 7. pursue a positive and satisfying existence;

sentences.sentence: "You must accept yourself and others if you really want to live"

means.word_mean: 1. actually being performed at the time of hearing or viewing;

sentences.sentence: "brought to you live from Lincoln Center"
"live entertainment involves performers actually in the physical presence of a live audience"

means.word_mean: 2. showing characteristics of life; exerting force or containing energy;

sentences.sentence: "tossed a live cigarette out the window"
"got a shock from a live wire"
"a live ball is one in play"
"the club members are a really live bunch"

means.word_mean: 7. in current use or ready for use;

sentences.sentence: "live copy is ready to be set in type or already set but not yet proofread"

auth_sentence.content: We can finally live the life that we choose.
auth_sentence.res_content: We can finally live the life that we choose.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We can finally live the life that we choose.

auth_sentence.content: Who knows, maybe southerners buy more live albums?
auth_sentence.res_content: Who knows, maybe southerners buy more live albums?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Who knows, maybe southerners buy more live albums?

auth_sentence.content: Most live on small mammals, birds and reptiles.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most live on small mammals, birds and reptiles.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most live on small mammals, birds and reptiles.

sentences.en: She lives about ten miles from my house.
sentences.cn: 她的住处离我家约十英里远。

sentences.en: As long as I live, the bridge lives.

means.word_mean: (按照规矩)管理生活，控制生活

sentences.en: He lives by a strict moral code.
sentences.cn: 他按照严格的道德准则生活。

means.word_mean: 以…为生；靠…过活(常与on或upon连用)

sentences.en: He lives mainly on his monthly income.
sentences.cn: 他主要靠自己的月收入生活。

means.word_mean: 以…为主食；靠吃…维持生存

sentences.en: The family lived on wild plants.

means.word_mean: (人物形象等)栩栩如生，生动传神

sentences.en: The writer made this historical character live in his book.
sentences.cn: 作家在书中将这一历史人物描写得栩栩如生。

sentences.en: The general's feats will live after him.
sentences.cn: 将军的伟绩将永留人世。

sentences.en: Eat to live but not live to eat.
sentences.cn: 人为了活着而吃饭, 而不是为了吃饭而活着。

sentences.en: We saw a real live rattlesnake!
sentences.cn: 我们看到一条真的响尾蛇！

sentences.en: We cooked the steak over live coals.
sentences.cn: 我们是把牛排放在燃烧的煤上烤的。

sentences.en: Be careful, this wire is live.
sentences.cn: 当心, 这根电线有电。

means.word_mean: 未爆炸的; 随时可用的

sentences.en: They found a live bomb in the valley.
sentences.cn: 他们在山谷里发现一枚未爆炸的炸弹。

sentences.en: Shortage of funds is still very much a live issue.
sentences.cn: 资金短缺仍然是当前的重大问题。

means.word_mean: 现场直播的, 实况转播的

sentences.en: It was a live broadcast, not a recording.
sentences.cn: 那是现场直播, 不是录音。

means.word_mean: 实地, 现场地, 以直播方式

sentences.en: The football game is going out live.
sentences.cn: 足球赛正在进行实况转播。

jushi.english: As long as I live, the bridge lives.
Give up your arms and live!
The coal miner was so seriously injured that he might not live till morning.
jushi.chinese: 这个煤矿工人的伤势很重,也许活不到早晨。
